message: Hey guys, me and a few other people are working on a London Django meetup.
It would be great if someone where interested to work on this with us. I'm working on sponsorships and a location at the moment, presentations would be very welcome.

Yep, +1 from me.  I work for a digital agency in the West end, where the number of django developers is rapidly growing (around 5 at the moment, but lots of converting PHP devs).  Would definitely be interested.
Are you aware of/talking to the (currently sort of dormant) DJUGL people? @garethr et al

Might be worth keeping in touch with us folks over at http://brightonpy.org/ - We've had a couple of really well attended talks lately, and it'd be good to have some speaker cross-over with other groups.  I might be up for coming up to London some evening to give a talk on some combination of Django / Web APIs / REST / django-rest-framework

Hi Guys, the DJUGL team have been working on the latest event for the last month or so. We have secured a room at the guardian who have agreed to host, we have had some talks submitted and I will be providing everyone with Pizza and Beer. Tickets have initially been limited to 50 as it has been a while since the event has been run. If we have underestimated the interest and sell out quickly we will release more tickets. registrations and talk submissions can be made here. http://bit.ly/khVysQ
OK, well I spoke about 12 hours too soon it seems :-/
@tomchristie didn't know about brightonpy, would be great to go down to brighton too sometime. :)
